name: X2Brussels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a gem! We are so glad we stayed here! Xavier and his mother are wonderful hosts.
reviews.title: Excellent B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very comfortable. Lots of space, clean and modern facilities, free wifi – everything you need for a great stay. We stayed on the top floor. It was raining the three nights we were there so were unable to open the skylights which made the room a bit warm. A celling fan would have helped. As others have said, there is not a lift so travel light and be prepared for stairs! Breakfast was as you would expect with fresh squeezed orange juice. Perfect start to the day.
reviews.title: Don't Come Here If You Don't Want a Romantic Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The B&B is in an excellent location to visit central Brussels. Xavier really knows his city and provides great recommendations!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were traveling for our anniversary. Our family had reached out to Xavier to arrange for a bottle of champagne. When we returned home we found out that he wouldn’t let them pay for it! I’m so glad we shared it with Xavier and his mom! Thank you! It was a very kind and much appreciated gesture!
reviews.title: Nicely styled B & B centrally located.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This bed & breakfast was even better than we had expected. Plenty of space, clean, uncluttered rooms, warm & friendly service, and contemporary decor. Breakfast was delicious and the shower is huge. Location is walking distance to subways, and also several local gathering places.
reviews.title: This B&B was the best part of our visit
Great location, peaceful atmosphere
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a vacation in which we did spend two nights in Brussels at X2Brussels b&b. It is on a quiet street, yet only a few blocks from the Grand Place. When we arrived, we had just had an very long day of traveling; our room, on the first floor up was incredibly peaceful with calming decor. We were happy to be in such a relaxing environment. Our room had an amazingly large bathroom with a great tub, the only downside is that my husband is very tall and prefers showers. The other slight negative is that the stairs were very very loud as the stairway has no fabric to buffer the echoes and sound, this wasn't a big issue since most foot traffic was during the day. Breakfast was a nice selection of breads, cheese, and ham with fresh orange juice and coffee or tea.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we checked in, we were given some great suggestions as well as a map of sights to see. This was wonderful since we had limited time. I would definitely return, and would recommend this b&b to others, though I think it is a better place for couples or single travelers rather than families, due to the way noise carries and could disturb other guests.
reviews.title: A great place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for the weekend and received a very warm welcome from the charming hosts.
reviews.title: Just the ticket

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the attic room, which was clean and minimalist, but I like that. Be warned there are 62 steps so you have to be up to that. It is in walking distance of the Place du Sablon which has lots of nice shops, bars, restaurants and chocolate shops. If you walk the other way the area is slightly less upmarket and perhaps not for the fainthearted after dark. Breakfast is fine and you can have eggs as well. Would return!
reviews.title: The place to be !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights at this lovely B&B/Guest House. Easy 10-15 min walk from the Eurostar terminal. Right from the first moment, the greeting was warm and friendly. We were also given a real insight in where to visit in Brussels - v. helpful.The room was spacious, comfy and very clean, as was the bathroom; 10/10 for hygiene. Breakfast was very pleasant in a nice dining room, shared with the other guests. I have absolutely no hesitation in recommending this B&B to other visitors. It was both our birthdays and Xavier very kindly looked after us. Brussels is no Rome or Venice, but do not be put off; its a GREAT city to explore and experience. There is not the 'artificial/commercial' tourism you get in other cities; what you get is real Belgian life. Enjoy a walk, and stop a while for something to eat and a beer. You can eat something very nice for c.15 euro per head and a good beer will cost you c.3.50 euro. Brussels also felt very safe to walk around,even late at night. Finally, the beaches weren't as nice as here in Cornwall, UK! (a hidden secret - we have the BEST beaches in the world)
reviews.title: Personal Touch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This B&B is brand new and in beautiful shape. The rooms are very design and housekeeping keeps things very clean. Overall a really wonderful experience. The bed had to be the most comfortable sleep we have had in years. The location is wonderfully central: easy to get to and from trains, transport and main sightseeing. Everything is within walking distance right between the upper and lower sections of central Brussels. The only glitch [and its just for the faint of hear] this B&B is located in an up and coming neighborhood that sits on the edge of an area that might make some folks nervous. If you dont want to see the working class section of this city, dont walk from Midi station. Otherwise enjoy the change from one block to the next!
reviews.title: So Comfy

reviews.text: I can only complement the owners for their nice place, large room, good breakfast, exelent coffeeand their help in solving difficultists.
reviews.title: the best service besides the very good room

reviews.text: the location us just superb, near mart place. You can just walk. every thing us near by, And every question that you have or need for assistence just ask them !!!
reviews.title: Top Notch!

reviews.text: Nicest BnB we have ever stayed in! The non-descript building does not prepare you for what is inside. Very modern upscale place. The owner greeted us and made us feel very welcomed. Gave advice on sights, restaurants and where to buy those famous chocolates. Very close (walking distance) to Grand Place and Mannekin Pis. Car is left in a secured garage across the street. Great coffee and breakfast await you in the morning. Our GPS did not take straight to the door. Ensure you get good instructions prior to heading out. Would stay here again!
reviews.title: My Home Away

reviews.text: I went looking for something better, something finer than a standard hotel in Brussels which I could return to...somewhere that had personal touch, tasteful design and caring proprietors. I can honestly say I found it:)
reviews.title: Great b&b run by friendly people

reviews.text: I chose this B&B after a personal recommendation, and I'm really glad I did. Most of the Brussels hotels I stay in are impersonal, expensive, charge for wifi and, frankly, dull. I have stayed in another B&B in Brussels which was OK, but more importantly had only one room, so it's been difficult to get back in. X2Brussels is the opposite of Brussels hotels: it's personal, inexpensive (I wouldn't go so far as to say cheap), has lovely rooms and free wifi (not just free...it also remembers you so you don't have to keep logging in like in some places), and a great breakfast...plus a great welcome when I arrived. They have three rooms, so the chances of getting in on another occasion must be better.
reviews.title: Finally, a really good Brussels B&B

reviews.text: Nicely positioned, too. Walking distance (15 minutes) from the Eurostar (how nice to just walk past the huge taxi queue!), and just a 6 minute stroll to the Grande Place. Close to the Metro and bus stops. And best of all, outside the European Quarter, ie, in a proper area of town, not Euroland. You get room and outdoor keys.
reviews.title: Charming personal touch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in the room at the top: huge, white, minimalist (in a good way). Wooden floor. Big comfortable bed, very big flatscreen HD TV, good towels and toiletries, huge walk-in power shower, windows that open, lots of power points, clothes hangers you can take off the rail, adjustable heating – and even though it was at the top of the house the wifi worked well. A table to work at, with two chairs. The room was quiet, too. Spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was outstanding. Fresh rolls/croissant/bread; cheese and ham; an offer of a cooked egg; large selection of jams (including marmalade); proper espresso, and more cups offered; freshly squeezed orange juice. And a nice surprise, cooked by co-owner Xavier's mum: pain perdu. Yum.
reviews.title: Great place, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Go there. Just don't tell too many people about it!
reviews.title: X2Excellence

description: Located in a quiet street in the very heart of Brussels city centre and at close proximity of the grand place, this newly renovated Bed and Breakfast offers an intimate court yard, a chic dining area and 3 stylish rooms, perfect for business and leisure travellers alike . Each room is bathed in natural light with its own bathroom, Flat screen with satellite, WiFi and workspace, as well as all the small details to ensure your comfort and make your stay unforgettable.
